Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim; glazed streakily black below with lotus flower in added red and added white; exterior: dot band between two narrow bands at rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos has mistakenly labelled this sherd 'NA60'. For parallels regarding the rim pattern, see British Museum 1924,1201.663 and 1924,1201.576. According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU20), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios, despite the high content of calcium.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, pl. 152, no. 1105) (Incorrectly named NA60 and number not precised)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1205) (phase 2)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (pp. 78-9, 82-3, fig. 2) (NAU 20)
